body:
@chrisduerr I was able to replicate the problem that was described by the OP. Figured I'd lend a hand.

The glutin example you provided with the patch runs fine on my machine. It just shows a white empty window.

I tested a few Alacritty releases and discovered [0.3.0](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/releases/tag/v0.3.0) introduced the bug. [0.3.0 RC3](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/releases/tag/v0.3.0-rc3) works fine.


I decided to spot test the commits between 0.3.0 RC3 and 0.3.0 and found that [this commit to window.rs](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/commit/6757acbb824e8be9968529a66e9a75a0a2ea2f5d#diff-2ce3f8d26915325bbd02de9e0056281e) caused it.

Every commit before then works fine when `decorations: none` is used.

Hope that helps you.

I got a runtime error trying to run that PR
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24833917/59957950-96d9b000-9464-11e9-8703-e3a1e7ac81e6.png)

This is what I ran to get that PR and build it:
```
[cygw alacritty]$ git fetch origin pull/2438/head:pr2438
remote: Enumerating objects: 33, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (33/33), done.
remote: Total 62 (delta 32), reused 32 (delta 32), pack-reused 29
Unpacking objects: 100% (62/62), done.
From https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty
 * [new ref]         refs/pull/2438/head -> pr2438
[cygw alacritty]$ git checkout pr2438
Previous HEAD position was cd8d537 Add new icon to macOS binary
Switched to branch 'pr2438'
[cygw alacritty]$ cargo build --release
```

Could you uncomment this line:
https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/pull/2438/files#diff-65362e8e7fbdb92518e6216cd7f10722R575

I think that's causing the unimplemented error, but it should be irrelevant for working properly.

Did you mean comment the line out instead of uncomment?

If so, I commented it out, got a warning about dead_code, but it compiled.  Running it didn't result in a runtime error, but the problem persists.

issue.title: Windows window without decoration not rendering properly

labels.name: C - needs investigation
labels.description: Issue must be confirmed and researched

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
This has been reported to Alacritty in https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/2564.

It seems like `with_decorations(false)` causes the rendering on Windows to break. In the glutin example, this results in a white window. If transparency is enabled, this will just lead to a completely transparent window.

body:
Since the glutin example was just a white window instead of the rectangle it is supposed to render, I've reported this problem upstream:

https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/979

@JDTX This should have been fixed 4 days ago in winit, I'm not sure if the version you've tested already had that fix in or not.

Could you test the #2438 PR again, I've bumped it again so the IME failure should not arise anymore and the latest winit version should be included. Would be much appreciated.

@chrisduerr I received a compilation error with the latest code from the PR.
```
warning: unused imports: `SizeInfo`, `Term`
  --> alacritty\src\window.rs:38:32
   |
38 | use alacritty_terminal::term::{SizeInfo, Term};
   |                                ^^^^^^^^  ^^^^
   |
   = note: #[warn(unused_imports)] on by default

error[E0599]: no method named `with_visibility` found for type `winit::window::WindowBuilder` in the current scope
   --> alacritty\src\window.rs:309:14
    |
309 |             .with_visibility(cfg!(windows))
    |              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: did you mean: `with_visible`

error: aborting due to previous error
```
@chrisduerr That looks like you use the former name of `with_visible` which was renamed in https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/commit/2b89ddec15c897 on June 12 (almost 2 weeks ago).

@felixrabe Thanks for the information. I ran these two commands against the PR to update them,
```
sed -i "s/with_visibility/with_visible/g" alacritty/src/window.rs
sed -i "s/with_transparency/with_transparent/g" alacritty/src/window.rs
```

@chrisduerr It built with the above changes, and it works now with decorations set to none!
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24833917/60081257-0cf54580-96f7-11e9-8f6c-216054d88313.png)
Thanks for the help with testing, looks like this will get fixed as soon as the glutin Evlp2 PR is merged.

issue.title: Update to winit/glutin EventLoop 2.0
issue.body:
This takes the latest glutin master to port Alacritty to the EventLoop
2.0 rework.

This changes a big part of the event loop handling by pushing the event
loop in a separate thread from the renderer and running both in
parallel.

TODO:
 - [x] Resize issues (https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/pull/2438#issuecomment-505518232)
 - [x] `run_return` support for macOS (https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/1005)
 - [x] Resizing extremely slow
 - [x] Font size change not updating pty size
 - [x] Message bar does not update PTY size properly
 - [x] Incorrect window dimensions when moving Alacritty between different DPI monitors
 - [x] Font size not updating when moving Alacritty between different DPI monitors
 - [x] Clean up code / resolve remaining TODOs
 - [x] Incorrect startup DPI on X11 (https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/998)
    -> ~~:zap: Still broken when spawning a floating window in i3~~
    -> Workaround implemented
 - [x] Make sure before merging all the linked issues have change log entries
 - [x] Clear errors on message bar reload

Fixes #2796.
Fixes #2694.
Fixes #2643.
Fixes #2625.
Fixes #2618.
Fixes #2601.
Fixes #2564.
Fixes #2456.
Fixes #2438.
Fixes #2334.
Fixes #2254.
Fixes #2217.
Fixes #1789.
Fixes #1750.
Fixes #1125.
